chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert S Thurmond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert S Thurmond appeared by video.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Robert S Thurmond.  Attorney Anthony Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Resolution reached but requires payment of restitution of approximately $3000. Attorney Mickelson requests time for defendant to obtain restitution. State does not object. Court proposes wage assignment to ensure payments toward restitution are being made. Defendant opposes wage assignment. Court orders defendant to pay $1200 to Clerk of Court prior to next status. If paid, defendant may appear by phone/video. If not paid, defendant to be present in person.
Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert S Thurmond appeared by video.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Robert S Thurmond.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charge. Attorney Mickelson heard. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert S Thurmond appeared by video.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Robert S Thurmond.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Mickelson has been appointed. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
